title: Tanzania: MP, Three Others Injured in Chopper Accident
text:
Zimbabwe: Outrage Over Govt Profligacy 
Mr Nassari who is among the injured said the mishap was forewarned by a local church minister who previously told the MP about a bad dream he allegedly had, adding that he had a premonition that something terrible would happen to him. "And sure enough this proved to be the case," claimed the legislator. 
One of the crash victims, Ms Eva Kaaya, who is aspiring to vie for councilor of Nkoanrua Ward, is reported to be in critical condition after suffering broken ribs and she is currently in the intensive care unit at the hospital here. 
"The three will be released very soon except for Ms Kaaya," stated the Doctor-in-Charge at Seliani Hospital, Dr Paul Kissanga. Other injured people include the chopper pilot, Mr William Slaa and the Secretary for CHADEMA in Arumeru-East Constituency, Mr Elisa Mungure as well as Mr Nassari himself. 
The craft, apparently had only four people aboard. The Police in Arusha Region have confirmed the incident but the cause for the accident is yet to be explained. 
The blue 'Key Arreton' helicopter belongs to the Moshi-Urban Member of Parliament and one of CHADEMA benefactors, Mr Philemon Ndesamburo. 
What saved the occupants when it crashed, according to eyewitnesses, was the fact that, it fell onto thick branches of trees that held it above, otherwise the craft would have hit hard on the ground. Tanzania
